place.name: FEN DRAYTON
place.gazetteerText: DRAYTON (Fen), a parish in the district of St. Ives and county of Cambridge; on an affluent of the river Ouse, at the boundary with Huntingdon, 2 miles SW of Swavesey r. station, and 3¼ SE by S of St. Ives. Post town, Fen-Stanton, under St. Ives. Acres, 1, 496. Real property, £4, 059. Pop., 445. Houses, 107. The property is much subdivided. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Ely. Value, £100. Patron, Christ's College, Cambridge. The church was restored in 1855. A Wesleyan chapel was built in 1866. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
